revised_title: Lunar Diurnal Magnetic Variation at Greenwich and Other Observatories
tldr: The author investigates the lunar diurnal magnetic variation, particularly the magnetic declination at Greenwich, and examines how it is affected by changes in the moon's distance and the sunspot epoch. The study also explores the influence of magnetic activity on the variation. The research uses a novel method of reduction and covers a period of 63 years, from 1848 to 1914, with 20,762 lunar days of observations.
